name: M Green
text:
I just moved into my new place and needed to furnish every room. I spent days and weeks looking for high-quality furniture at different stores but unfortunately the high-quality furniture came with a high quality price. I couldn’t believe how much it cost for a dining room table,  couch and other furniture items.

Then Someone recommended the  bargain Center,

I was Initially discouraged about all of the places and wasted time and I spent looking for unfounded  items. however I decided to give this place a visit.

I walked in the store and saw all of the high-quality furniture and was impressed with the  cost.  When I say high-quality  I am referring to durable top-of-the-line furniture that you would  see at the Elite stores.

I was able to furnish my living room, dining room, three bedrooms and I was able to rent a U-Haul truck at the same location to transfer my furniture to my new place.

Everyone in the store was so friendly and helpful. I will definitely recommend this place for furniture needs, clothing needs, most of all your items.

PS. I picked up some boots and already received five compliments.

name: Xandi Andersen
text: Best thrift store in Montgomery! I go in about once a week and I find great deals every time I go. Sometimes they'll surprise you with a discount at checkout or they'll throw a free gift in your bag during the holidays . The staff there are such kind-hearted people, too. They're always happy to be there and most are volunteers who just enjoy serving their community. They even keep shelves outside stocked with nonperishable items so folks in the neighborhood can take what they need even after the store closes.

name: Patricia Holliday June
text: I recommend them for great bargains, awesome customer service, and what they do for the community. You have to visit and show your support for our locally owned businesses that service our residents, and provide accessible location and great prices! Appreciate what they did for our community event! Appreciated the support of Mrs. Browder, and her son who now manages the thrift store.

name: Melissa Davis
text: I was looking for a kitchen dining table for my kitchen and I went to 3 different goodwills first but they were either in bad shape or not a set. I went to the bargain center and as soon as I walked in there was this gorgeous 3 piece set that was exactly what I was looking for and it was reasonably priced! I used to shop there a long time ago but I forgot about it. I can tell you that the next time I need a particular piece, this is the very first place that I will come to plus the staff is very friendly and helpful!

name: Derrick Watkins
text: This is my favorite thrift store in the Montgomery metro area. Mr. Browder and staff are the friendliest and most  accommodating people I have ever encountered. I have found many excellent deals here. God bless this store and staff!!!

name: myla harper
text: Today something amazing took place at the Bargain Center. A woman came in the store wanting to rent a Uhaul, crying and all upset because she was put out and had no place to go. Mr. Stephen Browder became her hero. He began to make phone calls while also calming the woman down . Before leaving the thrift store she had a place to stay, Faith Crusade Montgomery Rescue Mission women’s shelter, a storage to put her items in, a Uhaul Truck, and help to gather her items and ensure that she was safe. I witnessed the woman’s tears of sorrow transform into tears of joy as she thanked Mr. Browder, his team and Jesus. The staff is simply amazing demonstrating the love of God to those who are in need of real help. Yes I would recommend all come to the Bargain Center Thrift Store to shop and spread the word about Uhaul rentals.

Both summer AND winter clothing. I dropped off 5-6 bins full of men’s khaki shorts, khaki pants, jeans, dress shirts, & athletic gear. ***ALL are brand names such as POLO Ralph Lauren, J.Crew, Patagonia, Vineyard Vines, Coastal Cotton, Southern Marsh, Nike/Adidas, & much more!

***Most items are NEW w/ TAGS or barely worn clothes! All items are in GREAT CONDITION.*** (size 29-32 in mens/boys pants. Men’s size Small & Medium in shirts. Some “boys XL 18-20” in dress shirts as well.)

This is my brother’s first year at West Point (go Army!). He isn’t allowed to come home very much these next 4 years, so we have cleaned out his entire closet & have taken ALL of his clothes to Fashion Exchange in Athens, AL!

These clothes will only be allowed to stay on the floor for just 3 months. Go check them out soon!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to visit us and leave us feedback. Yes, we are currently set up in a mobile home. We agree that at this time it is more of a thrift store. We will use your comment and those of others to continue striving to provide quality and affordable new and used items for the entire family as we seek to provide what we think is a needed service in our local community. We hope that you will come back and tell others. We hope that in the future, we will be a place where other vendors will be able to come set up as well in the future.

Kristi
I am sorry that your experience is not as expected. It is our goal to exceed customer expectations. I am curious what prices have gone up. We have tried to maintain prices as best as possible over the past several years. Our clothing, dvd, electronics and kitchen prices have remained consistent for the past 10 years. Furniture does fluctuate based on quality and availability. Because we are a second hand store, cleanliness is a constant concern. name: mercymade8
text:
Everything has changed in the Loaves & Fishes stores they look nice but the prices have went up. From what i gather, management has changed.
I used to would shop at several of the locations at least once a week. I would pick up things for others who were in need as well. If it didnt work for them at thrift prices i could afford to buy it & put it back til i found someone who could wear/use it.
Now I can't afford to do that. The last time I went shopping there, I came back with 3 used clothing items which cost me around $15. My mom came over with new clothes she had gotten on sell fot $1 at Walmart. The point of thrifting is being thrifty. JCPenny's & other department stores has new clothes for clearance around these prices.
I enjoy the "treasure seeking" process of going to the thrift store but it is more fun when the treasure wasn't wrestling for a spot in your budget.
I'm not the only one who feels this way. The parking lots used to stay full of customers. Now nit nearly as much traffic goes through there to weed through the donated goods. Thankfully there are more & more options popping up around our area.
I will still go by there sometimes but not my go to spots anymore.

text: It’s a pretty good GoodWill with a nice selection of stuff.  But they go a little crazy with their pricing sometimes.  I was there today and saw they had a jacket and they were asking $75!  That’s crazy!  It’s almost insulting thinking that they think they can sell a used jacket for that much.  And I actually looked up that jacket on ebay and plenty of people were ASKING ~$75 but once I checked all the sold listings, people were GETTING ~$30 for that jacket.  And that’s not the only thing I’ve seen there that’s been grossly overpriced.  Like a pair of used dirty Adidas shoes without the laces had a $25 price written ON the shoes.  Why would you write ON the shoes you claim to be $25?  I’m probably going to stop going there is I keep on seeing things like this.

name: alicia kenerley
text:
The oddest shopping experience ever. No one speaks to you, no one thanks you for coming in or offers any interaction which I find very odd since they are supposed to be Christian. I mean where is the love?
Plus the prices are not thrift store prices, more like consignment pricing but the staff is my main gripe.
It cost nothing to be nice. One man who stocks or something has almost brushed my arm but never said as much as excuse me.
I find them to stay in a little huddle rather than engaging their customers, all two or three of them!
I would not recommend this place for shopping or donating, there are charity closets which get the needed articles directly to the people in need rather than having 4 or 5 people zipping to and fro with a don't bother me attitude.
They even have several sarcastic signs showing the difference between stickers & tags and gosh if you dare ask them what color items are on sale they don't answer but point to the sign. I mean, really?
Very strange atmosphere and not worth feeling unwelcome in their little world.

resp.text:
Alicia,
We are so sorry your experience was not pleasant.  We do work very hard to maintain the store so that it will reflect Jesus Christ.  If we failed in that we hope you will forgive us and accept our sincere apology.  We only ask that you give us a second chance.

text: I'm very surprised by the negative reviews. I have been shopping here for at least the last 5 years, probably longer, and I have never had a negative experience. The majority of the staff are volunteers, only a very few of the employees are paid. No one has ever been rude to me... some of the older volunteers do seem a bit grouchy every now and again, but not to the point of what I would call rude. During my last visit I did notice that some of the home décor & furniture items do seem to have gone up in price, but the quality is good and I think it's still reasonable pricing. Their new addition on the building is nice. For anyone who is truly in need and can't afford the prices, all you need to do is ask to speak to someone in charge  & if you discuss your situation with them I am sure they would be willing to help.

They are making one hundred percent profit because the merchandise is donated to them. I do know that they help other organizations and people but it is just too expensive for poor people to shop. I have seen merchandise in there that was cheaper at Walmart or Dollar General new. They need to check their prices and compare with brand new merchandise. May God continue to bless them selling to people that can afford to shop there so that they can help others.🙏🏽🙏🏽🙏🏽

text: Wow! What an awesome shop! My family and I had to evacuate Panama City Beach due to Hurricane Michael and were staying at a hotel nearby. We saw this shop and had to stop in. What an excellent selection and very fairly priced. So many great books and home decore. But the best thing about our visit to the shop were the friendly staff members and fellow shoppers. So so kind and polite. That has been the best part about this whole ordeal of the hurricane situation, is the people we’ve met. So full of love and support. Thank you for helping to bring a smile to our faces during this difficult time. This is a fantastic store! There’s a little something for everyone.

text:
The Madison A New Leash on Life Thrift Store and Boutique totally lives up to its "Boutique" name.  You can find fabulous things at incredible prices.  They have a bit of everything!
The volunteers are dedicated to having the most inviting, welcoming store; while raising money to rescue and rehabilitate all kinds of animals.  I've seen dogs, cats (they now have a fun cat house), bunnies, guinea pigs  - in the store for you to meet.  This really is the best thrift store in Madison, AL!

resp.text: Thank you for shopping with us Kathy and for supporting our program! So glad you've found great items!

name: Ryan Cass
text: It’s a nice store with friendly staff, just be careful when trying to park it’s a small lot on a busy street.

name: amy faruqui
text: Awesome thrift shop!! Great prices! Loved the antique cabinet and beautiful rug I found here. Staff is super friendly. Love that the money from my purchases help the rescued animals in their program with medical costs.

resp.text: Thank you so much for supporting out program and we hope to see you again soon!

name: Cynthia Perry
text: I love shopping there! Most everyone is very nice and helpful! One of the things I don't like is not being able to use a buggy to shop but it is not very roomy in there so I understand that it would be pretty hard for people to try and maneuver a buggy around! I really like how strict they are on people wearing a mask during this pandemic! They have a really good selection of items, they pretty much have anything & everything you want & need!! Their prices are great!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for supporting our program!

text:

N. L. L. always has clean items in great condition. I have purchased several items that were brand new. The staff
is always friendly and eager to help.
** New Leash on Life is currently building a NO KILL animal shelter next to the thrift store. **
If you are a plumber, electrician, or have any skills that can assist with the building of the shelter,  I suspect they could use the help. New Leash on Life is a great store that supports a worthy cause.

She told me what they didn’t accept I could pick up “over there” not giving any instruction on where that would be. My husband and I walked around the counter looking for my items and could not find them. We asked her, “where are they?” And she acted like she didn’t hear us. So we just left. Whatever they didn’t take, they can have. Extremely unprofessional and I will not be back or recommend anyone else to do business with this company.

I was rather shocked. She clearly was rude, didn't listen and could care less. The manager is Kim and I plan to let her know. This was about 430pm. text: I wanted to sell some items before leaving town, so I took a basket full of clothes over on a Thursday afternoon at 4:30 PM and the girl behind the counter told me they weren’t buying clothes anymore that day because the (1?) person that buys had left already, so I had to leave my basket until I got back into town one Saturday. When I got to the store on Saturday around 5:45 PM two girls were behind the counter. I gave them my name and they pulled two items out of a black bin and I inquired about the whereabouts of my basket and the other clothes. The girl replied, “they’re over there,” and asked the other girl behind the counter to process my buy so she could go be on her phone. Once the buy was processed and I got my money, I waited a few minutes for one of them to get my items they didn’t buy. They didn’t, so I asked if I could have my basket. The girl who was on her phone said ambiguously, “they’re over there,” and pointed haphazardly towards a wall and went back to her phone. I found my items and left. This customer service is unacceptable and disappointing. I’ll be taking my business to Plato’s.

name: Keegan Williamson
text:
I can't believe all the negative reviews I'm seeing. Uptown is bar none, the best place in Dothan, or the tri-county area, to buy men's clothing. When I first moved to the area I immediately went to Plato's Closet to see what the Dothan branch had to offer, the short version is, not much. After going to Plato's several times in a 90 day time period and never finding anything of merit, a co-worker took me to Uptown Cheapskate one day before work. That's when it all made sense. The reason Plato's Closet was completely barren was because everybody went to Uptown, and I'm all for it because their price is easily half of what Plato's would charge and their selection is vastly superior.

I would also like to point out that the owner of Uptown has never been anything but extremely accommodating, courteous, and immensely helpful. If you don't like the value she gives you're clothing or accessories the solution is quite simple, shop elsewhere! As for me, when I'm able to not only buy two pairs of Bullhead pants(the clothing line has been discontinued since Pac-Sun went under and has become like finding a needle in a haystack) but also a beautiful yellow and blue Ralph Lauren cardigan, all for less than $30!? I know better than to look a gift horse in the mouth.

Truly leagues above their so called competition.

text: The lady that works there is extremely rude an unhelpful. Usually a stuffing her face with food in front of all the customers and it seems like it's a bother to help anyone that asks her questions. They need to find someone with SOME kind of personality because she doesn't need to be working with the public. To top it off they pull from the highest Ebay asking prices and mix them with the the highest sold(which are in pristine condition.) For example, they are selling s yellowed Super Nintendo with one controller and missing cords so it wouldn't work!! sold as is and the sold listings on Ebay for a pristine Nintendo with 2 controllers and a couple games as going for the $100 range. Wost customer service I've experience and by far the worst front of house I've experience. I would be ashamed to run a. business stuffing my face in front of customers and making it seem like it's a hassle to help someone. lady needs to change her or attitude or find a different job. oh yeah..her husband does all the main work so she just rides his coattails. don't shop here unless you want above Ebay prices with no guarantee it's going to work!!! maybe they will see this and respond! CHEERS! PS. ALL my friends that have visited stayed less then 5 minutes due to how rude she is.

name: Baylie Brooks
text: Very poor customer service. I called on Thursday five minutes after the store opened and purchased two pieces of furniture over the phone. I gave them my name and phone number and said I would come pick it up on Saturday. The sales lady took my information and said that was okay. I got a text message with a receipt where I had paid. Since my husband and I don’t have a truck, we rented a uhaul van Saturday morning to pick up the furniture and drove down from Birmingham. When we got to the store, the manager informed me they had sold our furniture to someone else. Instead of admitting they messed up, the manager continued to blame me for the mistake and said I never gave them my phone number. They texted me a receipt so they had my phone number somewhere. The manager still refused to take any responsibility for selling the furniture I had purchased to someone else. My husband insisted we should be compensated for renting a uhaul. The manager gave him $40 and said that was the best he could do. They refunded my money for the furniture, but at the end of the day, we went home empty handed and out $100 dollars.  They will never get my business again.

name: Steve H.
text:
We first saw this thrift store back in October of 2016 and wanted to browse around, but didn't get the opportunity.  This trip, we specifically made time and I'm glad that we did.

The store isn't large, as thrift shops go, but there's a whole lot of stuff inside.  From furniture to knickknacks to jewelry, there's probably something to pique your interest.  We picked up decorative items, dinnerware, cast iron, some melamine pool stuff, and an entire vintage 12-place setting of Franciscan dinnerware for $75.

Very nice people and the proceeds go to a good cause.  Only open Friday and Saturdays, 0900-1500.  If you ever are in the area, stop by and see what the locals donate...you most likely will find a few things that you can't live without.

name: Bill Coore
text:
This used to be a great thrift store. Years ago when they first opened they had an awesome selection and great prices. As the years went on they've gotten worse. Now they have a poor selection and the prices aren't that great. Anything decent gets thrown in the showcase with a hefty price tag. I rarely stop here anymore as a result. I don't know if they changed management or owners but whoever is in charge now isn't doing this place any favors. They keep changing the layout too and what used to be a nicely organized store now has random shelves everywhere with no real organization.

Also, the last few times I stopped here the whole place smelled nasty. Don't know what the deal is with that.

name: BJ Mac
text: Used to be a good thrift store to visit but not anymore. This store is so cluttered and junky that it is ridiculous. Went there today and even out around the donation boxes there is stuff piled everywhere looks like they have not picked it up in days and it was pouring down rain. All they really have is clothes and most of what I looked at should be in the thrash not hanging on a rank.  I also thought that thrift stores were to help out a good cause but when I ask an employee what there cause was she said they do not help anyone anymore. I won't go back there.

name: Trey Horton
text: I go in thrift stores all the time. I've got to say that this is the cleanest, best run store I've seen. It looks like you walk into Sears it's so clean and well organized and everyone was in matching vest. I also like the way they did extra discounts while I was shopping, At one point they said anything bought in the next hour was an additional 25% off. I hurried and saved about $16 more. (I was buying light that day) -  long story short I was impressed enough to write a good review. I am very critical of service and deals. This is a place I will come back to. I would definately recomend a trip to Planet Thrift.  - Trey Horton

name: Wriston Helms
text:
Not open to posted hours. Went 3 times, not open.
Update. They come back at my review with a snarky protest and suggest I can't read their sign or tell time.. Nice..
I assure you I can do both well.

The take-home message here is to check their Facebook page to see if they are following their own hours before you drive to the store.
Got it?

resp.text: Our hours are clearly posted on our facebook pg and on our front door of biz as being Tuesday through Saturday 10am to 5pm. If we ever have to close early, we make a sign on the door and post to social media. If we can't get up there we post to social media only. It's a shame that people have to leave vague negative reviews when we rarely close during our regular posted biz hours. If this person would've contacted us after "missing" us the first time we would have done what ever needed to be done to assist this potential customer but odds are they came on a day we are closed (always closed Sunday and monday) or they came after 5pm. It's that simple. I have documented time sheets that prove when our biz is open and many, many days we rarely close right at 5pm to accomodote shoppers in the store!
